bibl.title: Carry-on at Canopus: The Nilotic Mosaic from Palestrina and Roman Attitudes to Egypt.
bibl.note: The caricatures. - The format of the frieze and other Nilotic scenes. - Roman orientalism? - The image of Egypt in Roman literature. - The Palestrina Mosaic. - The mosaic as inspiration for Roman caricatures. - The date of the caricatures. - Conclusion.
bibl.seg: WALKER Susan, Carry-on at Canopus: The Nilotic Mosaic from Palestrina and Roman Attitudes to Egypt.
Roger MATTHEWS and Cornelia ROEMER (Edd.), Ancient Perspectives on Egypt = Encounters with Ancient Egypt (London, 2003) pp. 191-202, 6 figg. n./bl. et coul.

The caricatures. - The format of the frieze and other Nilotic scenes. - Roman orientalism? - The image of Egypt in Roman literature. - The Palestrina Mosaic. - The mosaic as inspiration for Roman caricatures. - The date of the caricatures. - Conclusion.
